result.execSummary:
The defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To sentence that the defendant is currently serving on 11CF120.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid with any prison wages or funds that the defendant may be entitled to and to be paid within the first year of ES.

The defendnat must obtain his GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To count #1 but consecutive to sentence that the defendant is currently serving on 11CF120.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid with any prison wages or funds that the defendant may be entitled to and to be paid within the first year of ES.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To counts #1 and #3 but consecutive to sentence that the defendant is currently serving on 11CF120.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid with any prison wages or funds that the defendant may be entitled to and to be paid within the first year of ES.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:17 AM. Also called 15CF152, 15CF48 anbd 15CF160. State - has tendeered a plea in 15CF160 and 15CF152 and to compelte same process in other two cases - were waiting for paperwork to be completed by both parties and if it is - we can proceed today with sentencing. Joy states that Judge Kussel has signed the appropriate paperwork. Court checks those two files and does see the proper paperwork that is needed to proceed today. State - defendant entered a plea to count #1 on 15CF152 and to counts #1, #3 and #6 on 15CF160, no pleas have yet been entered on 15CF20 and 15CF48; State instructs Court that the defendant would plead to counts #1 and #4 as alleged on 15CF20 and DRI remaining counts, 15CF478 - plead G to counts #2 and #3 with count #1 being DRI. Joy and Daniels agree. State - joint recommendation of 10 years in prison consisting of 5 in and 5 out, not joint is if the time should run concurrent or consecutive to time he is currently serving, Joy and Daniels agree. Daniels pleads G to counts #2 and #3 on 15CF48 and Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Daniels plead G to counts #1 and #4 on 15CF20 and Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #5 on same case. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - has complied with victim notification requirements - follow joint recommendation - requsting time to run consecutive to any time that the defendant is currently serving for stated reasons. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - requesting time to run concurrent to any time that the defendant is currently serving for stated reasons - discussion on credit - suggests conservatorship for defendant's finances. Daniels makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: will be running the sentences consecutive to each other; 15CF20 - #1 - 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 in and 5 out - conseuctive to sentence he is currently serving, #4 - 10 years in Prison with 5 in and 5 out - concurrent to count #1; 15CF152 - count #1 - 9 months in jail - concurrent with count #1 on 15CF20 but consecutive to current prison term; 15CF48 - #2 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to count #1 on 15CF20 and consecutive to current prison term; #3 - 6 years in WI State Prison consisting of 3 in and 3 out - consecutive to current prison time; 15CF16 - #1 - 3.5 years of WI prison with 1.5 years in and 2 out - consecutive to current prison term; #3 - 3.5 years in prison, consisting of 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to current prison term; #6 - 6 years in WI State Prison - consisting of 3 years in and 3 out - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to current prison term, $1000.00 fine plus costs and assessment on all counts - take bond posted - take any money due thru prison wages - remainder due within first year on ES, obtain GED, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample, eligible for earned release and substance abuse, right to appeal, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, no credit available, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. Also called 15CF152, 15CF160 and 15CF48. State - defendant is attempting to accomplish a transfer of cases back to Judge Stenz for all to be plead out in front of Judge Stenz. Joy responds and updates Court on cases, order to transfer, etc. Court would like to proceed on 15CF152 and 15CF160. Joy states that there is a global agreement on all four cases. Court responds. Discussion on issue. Court adjourns all matters until paperwork is completed to complete the transfer back to FC, continues bond. Attorney Joy to get a date from JA's when the paperwork is completed. Court sets for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sidney S. Daniels Jr.
Current: PO Box 19033, Green Bay Correctional Institution, Green Bay, WI 54307-9033 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2016)
Prior: 5039 Billy Daniels Lane, Crandon, WI 54520
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels, in custody, in court with attorney Jeffery Joy. District attorney, Simono does not appear as he is in another case with Judge Kussel, court accepts representation of Joy today. Called 15CF152 & 15CF160.  Joy states they have reached and agreement; 15CF160 - Daniels would enter a guilty plea to counts 1, 3 & 6. All other counts DRI. 15CF152 - Daniels would enter NC plea to count 1 and DRI remaining counts. Joy indicates there are two other cases 15CF48 & 15CF20 - originally tabbed for Judge Kussel and Joy's intention is to bring back those cases to Stenz, to resolve globaly. State will be recomending a sentence of 10 years, 5 years in WI State Prision and 5 years of extended supervision, consecutive to current sentence.  Joy is free to argue for sentence to be concurrent to current sentence. Court will accept all cases, with no objection from defendant or Judge Kussel. 15CF152 - defendant pleads NC to count 1, Court DRI counts 2 & 3. 15CF160 - Count 1, 3 & 6 defendant pleads G. Court DRI counts 2, 4, 5, & 7. Court goes over PLQ with defendant, finds the defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, waives his constitutional rights and right to JT, court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudges guilty. Court would assume State has complied with Victim notification and no restitution order.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm. State to prepare writ.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:13 PM. Also called 15CF160. Joy - not resolved for stated reasons, states he is counsel on all of the defendant's cases, would like a 2 week adjournment. Defendant is serving a long revocation. Court continues bond on both cases and sets both cases for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:10 AM. Called 15CF152 and 15CF160. State here for STC. Attorney Joy will be representing Mr. Daniels, informs court that they do not have discovery as of today and asks for FPT to be scheduled.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels appears via video from FC jail with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:14 PM. Also called 15CF160. Roley informs court that he has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel on both cases at the request of the client. State - both cases were set for FPT. Daniels agrees he would like to substitute attorney with Jeff Joy. Joy - indicates there may be a conflict on one case and the conflict would need to be waived. Roley has not went over plea offer and can provide copys to attorney Joy. Court sets for STC. Court will allow Roley to withdraw and accepts the substitution of counsel, Jeff Joy will file notice of retainer. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels, in custody from FC jail, in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:50 AM. Here for PH. State calls Deputy William Hujet, 9:51 AM. State directs. Record reflects identification of defendant, 9:55 AM. Roley cross-examines, 9:59 AM. Witness excused, 10:00 AM. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files information, mirrors. Proceed to ARGN. Roley waives further reading and enters pleas of NG to all counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:12 AM. Also called 15CF152. Roley has complaints but would like the Court to go over them again regarding the repeater allegations, Court instructs on the repeater allegations on 15CF160 and gives those penalties. Roley and Daniels understand charges and penalties, waives further reading of both cases, requests PH on both cases within time limits. Court continues bond on 15CF160, sets for PH. State - bond - 15CF152 - signature bond. Roley has no objections. Court - $5000.00 signature bond on 15CF152, no consumption of alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
